title: Hard to understand error when trying to create an use a mutable string literal

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
fn bar(_: &mut str) {
}
fn foo() {
    let mut x = "qwerty";  // x is declared as `mut`
    bar(&mut x);           // <-- this line doesn’t compiles
}
```

The current output is:

```rust
error[[E0596]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0596): cannot borrow data in a `&` reference as mutable
 --> src/lib.rs:5:9
  |
5 |     bar(&mut x);
  |         ^^^^^^ cannot borrow as mutable

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0596`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

---

I think that the error should be on the line above (`let mut x = "qwerty"`) since, from what I understand, string literals are always immutable. So it shouldn’t be possible to create a `mut` binding to them.

[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=94ac533d21fc3d2312a2062458d306c8)
